description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Lausanne" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Lausanne

places.generalDescription: Lausanne Cathedral, consecrated in 1275, is a stunning Gothic masterpiece that has been an important landmark in Switzerland since medieval times. The exterior of the cathedral is impressive with its ornate painted portal, belfry, and vibrant rose window. Inside, visitors can admire the grand organs, 13th-century choir stalls, and ancient stained glass windows. It also serves as a stop for pilgrims following the Camino de Santiago within Switzerland.

sources.snippet: Either via the walk described in the first bullet or via public transportation, I recommend seeing the gothic cathedral crowning Lausanne. The exterior is impressive (the interior less so, though you can enter for free and it does feature a massive organ worth a gander if you go in) and the square next to the cathedral overlooking the town and the lake is a don‚Äôt-miss. If you go up there at night, the lights on the cathedral fa√ßade are beautiful (and romantic!), as is the town below lit up at night.
sources.shortName: What to See and Do in Lausanne, Switzerland

sources.snippet: After a stop at Lausanne Cathedral, cross the Le Flon pedestrian bridge to reach the Montbenon Esplanade - one of the most beautiful balconies with a view of Lake Geneva. In front of the Coll√®ge de Bellev√©d√®re there is a spacious terrace with a view over the lake. Continue up the Languedoc hill - a vineyard in the middle of the city to the Cr√™t de Montriond with a unique panoramic view of Lake Geneva, the mountains and Lausanne.
sources.shortName: Lausanne city trip ideas | Spring HIGHlights

sources.snippet: The city‚Äôs solemn cathedral went up during the 13th century and was consecrated in 1275. That sound in the dead of night is the Lookout, who barks out the hours between 22:00 and 02:00 365 days a year and one of the last of his kind in Europe. One of the people to thank for the cathedral‚Äôs current appearance is the French master restorer Viollet-le-Duc.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lausanne (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: The Cathedral of Notre Dame is also in the old town in the Place de la Cathedrale. It is a beautiful example of Gothic architecture with its ornate spires, intricate stonework, and excellent art and sculptures. It is the ‚Äúlargest and arguably most important early Gothic church in Switzerland‚Äù.
sources.shortName: One day in Lausanne: the top things to do

sources.snippet: Lausanne Cathedral is undoubtedly a must-see attraction of the Vaud capital. An essential port of call for any visitor. Renowned as one of most beautiful gothic art monuments in Europe, the Cathedral offers a splendid view over the whole town, Lake Geneva and the Alps.
sources.shortName: 7 essential things to see in Lausanne ‚Äì Lausanne Tourisme

places.name: Lausanne Cathedral

reviews.text: Lausanne Cathedral is absolutely stunning, both day and night. Sitting high in the old city, it feels massive and full of history. We went just before mass, and the atmosphere was so peaceful-plus, the people there were really friendly, which made it even better. The stained-glass windows are incredible, bursting with color when the light hits them. And at night, the whole place glows beautifully, making it just as impressive as during the day. Definitely a place that stays with you!

I highly recommend talking a walk up through the old town to the cathedral. It's free, and a beautiful building with lots to see. You'll also get some great views of Lausanne from the front. If you want even better views you can pay a small fee and climb the bell-tower. This gives you 360 degree views of the city. Absolutely epic on a clear day. It's not for the faint-hearted or those with vertigo. Also not for those with major mobility problems. I use a walking stick due to bone spurs in my ankle and I made it OK. Just had to take it a bit slower.

Impressive cathedral with wonderful views of the town. A bit of a climb up steps if one takes the wrong route, but in any case well worth a visit. Large, quiet, peaceful, stained glass, statues, carvings, small and unobtrusive gift shop. Not overly commercial, and free to enter, as it should be but in some churches is not. Panoramic views of the town below.

places.address: Pl. de la Cath√©drale 1, 1005 Lausanne, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: The Olympic Museum in Lausanne is not your typical art museum, but it offers a unique blend of sports history, technology, and art. Situated in the city that houses the International Olympic Committee, this museum showcases sculptures and interactive multimedia displays dedicated to the Olympic Games. It's a must-visit for art and culture enthusiasts. The recently refurbished museum provides an interactive and educational experience, featuring artifacts, history, Olympic torches, posters, equipment, and clothing.

sources.snippet: Sports fans will love the permanent collection, which delves into the history of the Games and the values they aim to promote. You‚Äôll see programs, medals, flags, torches, clothing and equipment dating back more than a century; watch videos of opening ceremonies and memorable moments; and explore the meaning of the Olympic spirit through interactive, audiovisual exhibits. The TOM Caf√© is a good spot for a coffee with a view over the lake, while kids will love the park, with its running track and sculptures depicting Olympic sports.
sources.shortName: The 11 best things to do in Lausanne, Switzerland

sources.snippet: This impressively slick museum worships at the altar of the Olympic movement, whose headquarters are in Lausanne. It was renovated in 2013 to the tune of ¬£36 million and, as you‚Äôd hope for that amount of money, it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit. Divided into three themes, the permanent exhibition leans on interactive, multimedia displays, including games to test your own physical and psychological skills in Olympic disciplines.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Lausanne ‚Äì¬†Guide to the city

sources.snippet: It shows the pillars of Olympism - sport, art and culture - up close using state-of-the-art computer technology. Works by self-taught artists far removed from conventional art norms can be experienced in the epicentre of Lausanne's museums - the Collection de l'Art Brut. Unique: Plateforme 10, the brand new art quarter that brings together the Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts (MCBA), the Museum of Design and Applied Contemporary Art (mudac) and the renowned Photo Elys√©e.
sources.shortName: Lausanne city trip ideas | Spring HIGHlights

sources.snippet: Lausanne is also a cultural hotspot with its many internationally renowned museums, such as the Fondation de l‚ÄôHermitage (fine art) or the Art Brut Museum. Among that long list, the Olympic Museum remains an absolute must for lovers of sport. An interactive museum that takes you on a journey through the history of the Olympic Games and that‚Äôs sure to appeal to children and adults alike!
sources.shortName: 7 essential things to see in Lausanne ‚Äì Lausanne Tourisme

sources.snippet: The beautiful terrace offers spectacular views of the lake and mountains and if you visit at the weekend, you can enjoy a very reasonably priced three course brunch buffet of very tasty food. Finally if you‚Äôre looking for a little Michelin-magic with a view the recommendation I was given was La Table D‚ÄôEdgard, a one Michelin star restaurant located at Lausanne Palace & Spa.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Luxurious Things to Do in Lausanne, Switzerland

sources.snippet: The Olympic Museum is a reminder of Lausanne‚Äôs role as the world‚Äôs Olympic capital and the fact that it houses the headquarters of the International Olympic Committee. A visit here is a must, even if you don‚Äôt consider yourself a fan of the Olympic Games or have any sporting prowess (i.e. me!). I think it‚Äôs one of the best things to do in Lausanne.
sources.shortName: One day in Lausanne: the top things to do

sources.snippet: As the home city to the International Olympic Committee, Lausanne is essentially the Olympic Capital. So it‚Äôs apt that you can get the inside track on one of the world‚Äôs great sporting events. The museum is south of the centre at Ouchy, commanding a view over Lake Geneva from the top of the Olympic Park.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lausanne (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Relive Olympic moments at the Olympic Museum and descend the picturesque Escaliers du Marche from the cathedral into Place de la Palud for sightseeing in the winding streets of the old city.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Lausanne

places.name: The Olympic Museum

reviews.text: The Olympic Museum in Lausanne, Switzerland, is a place where you can learn all about the Olympic Games. It shows the history of the Games, from the very first Olympics to today. The museum has many cool things like Olympic medals, torches, uniforms, and photos of famous athletes. You can see displays that explain how the Olympics started, the athletes' journeys, and the values of the Games, like fair play and friendship. There are also fun, interactive activities to get involved with. The museum is located near Lake Geneva, with beautiful views of the water and mountains. It's a great place for anyone interested in sports and the spirit of the Olympics.

We had a fantastic experience here. I never thought that this would actually be a good museum that I would enjoy seeing because I assumed it was all about the games, but watching the history and seeing the interactivity of all of the different exhibits, this was really really good well worth the money and the Front Desk guy was really nice and I had some sort of ticket to something else so I was able to get a minimal discount and this was a really nice way to spend an afternoon.

I did not need to buy tickets in advance and even the lobby is gorgeous so unless you're waiting a long time, it was fine looking around there

We were here in early July and it was a nice walk along the lake to this museum perched on a small hill in the middle of a lovely park. Please visit the grounds even if you do not step inside the museum.  Nice views over the lake and pleasant outdoor Olympic related art and information sprinkled through the outdoor grounds and all of this is free to access. Inside it is a well curated place with lots of information for an Olympics fan. We did it all in about 2 hours. The gift shop is where you buy the entrance tickets.

Pro tip: if you do have a ticket and are there during the daytime, you do NOT need a lunch reservation to simply have a drink on their glorious outdoor terrace at the restaurant on the top floor. We just asked the host if we could sit outside for a drink and he enthusiastically said of course! What views!!! Drinks were not cheap but not more expensive than any other restaurant. So if you are curious and didn't make a lunch reservation, please do stop by and see if you can snag a seat outside. The staff were kind and helpful.

places.generalDescription: The Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts Lausanne is a large, modern art museum with a great permanent collection and excellent public transportation links. It's situated next to the train station, and has very modern architecture with a nice cafe on site.

sources.snippet: Begin your romantic tour in front of the splendid Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts Lausanne. Here, you will meet your local guide who will lead you on an enchanting journey through the city's history and culture.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Lausanne

sources.snippet: Unique: Plateforme 10, the brand new art quarter that brings together the Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts (MCBA), the Museum of Design and Applied Contemporary Art (mudac) and the renowned Photo Elys√©e.
sources.shortName: Lausanne city trip ideas | Spring HIGHlights

places.name: Cantonal museum of fine arts Lausanne

reviews.text: This museum exceeded all my expectations! The exhibits are incredibly well-organized, offering a deep dive into history, art, and culture. Every display feels thoughtfully put together, making it both engaging and informative for all ages. The staff is not only welcoming but also very knowledgeable, eager to share insights and answer questions. The overall layout is spacious, making it easy to navigate even on busy days without feeling crowded. There's something for everyone, from interactive displays to more traditional exhibits. Whether you're a casual visitor or a history enthusiast, this museum provides a rich and immersive experience that's hard to find elsewhere. Highly recommended for anyone looking to spend a few hours learning and exploring!
had the pleasure of visiting the Magdalena Abakanowicz exhibition in this beautiful museum. Everything felt like magic ‚Äì the whole walk was one big universe. The museum is absolutely wonderful.

The Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts in Lausanne is a must-visit every time I'm in the city. The facilities are outstanding, providing a perfect environment to appreciate art. The temporary exhibitions are exceptionally well-curated, showcasing a diverse range of artworks that keep me coming back for more. Whether you're an art enthusiast or a casual visitor, this museum offers a delightful experience that highlights both local and international talent. Highly recommended!

places.address: Pl. de la Gare 16, 1003 Lausanne, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: Amici is a cozy and chic restaurant that offers Southern Italian cuisine. The ambiance feels exotic, with almost everyone speaking Italian. It's advisable to make reservations in advance, especially on weekends. The restaurant is always full, and even if you end up with the last bar seats, it's a great opportunity to chat with the friendly staff and catch a glimpse of the kitchen.

sources.snippet: That‚Äôs our go-to phrase every time someone asks us why we recommend Amici so often. The quality of the food, the familiarity of the service, and the overall experience never disappoint. TLG tip: Ask Francesco to guide your order if you‚Äôre unsure‚Ä¶he has never steered us wrong.
sources.shortName: 10 Cozy Spots to Spend with Your Valentine(s) 2022

places.name: Amici

reviews.text: We were given gift vouchers at Christmas for this restaurant and I've no idea why it's taken us so long to visit. It's a little gem in Lausanne. A bit off the beaten track, so to speak, located near the Cathedral Amici is a lovely little Italian bistro. We had the beef to share and a few deserts accompanied by a very tasty red wine. The dry aged steak was amazing. Cooked rare and very buttery tasting. We would recommend the panna cotta desert. It's a star. Fantastic service. We will return.
Very nice and delicious. A bit too loud

I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom's to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of Ristorante Amici in its most recent old town location in Lausanne. Staff is very welcoming and very authentically italian. Appetizers were quite good but nothing to write home about. The ribeye was tasty but the cut was not perfect. Tiramisu was delicious.
Quite good value for money.

places.address: ATTENTION Nouvelle adresse!, Rue Cit√©-Derri√®re 11, 1005 Lausanne, Switzerland

places.generalDescription: Auberge de l'Abbaye de Montheron is a hidden gem located on the edge of the Jorat Natural Park, just a short drive from Lausanne. This gastro restaurant has earned a Michelin green star and offers a diverse menu featuring dishes made with local Vaud ingredients. The charming and bucolic terrace provides a peaceful setting to enjoy the culinary delights.

sources.snippet: Technically it‚Äôs in ‚ÄòCugy‚Äô but we‚Äôll just call it Lausanne because we‚Äôd love to claim this spot as our own. Auberge de l‚ÄôAbbaye de Montheron is hidden in a forest in the Jorat‚Äìa quick drive from Lausanne‚Äìand worth every minute of that drive. Playful, charming, cozy, imaginative‚Äìit‚Äôs a restaurant that will leave an impression on you and have you daydreaming about your next visit.
sources.shortName: 10 Restaurants to Celebrate Special Occasions in Lausanne

sources.snippet: It may be a short drive outside of the city center, but this place is worth it 100 times over. With creative geniuses in the kitchen and some of the kindest servers working the dining room, this gorgeous interior is one of the most romantic and cozy spots to spend any meal. TLG tip: Don‚Äôt be afraid to go vegetarian.
sources.shortName: 10 Cozy Spots to Spend with Your Valentine(s) 2022

places.name: Auberge de l'Abbaye de Montheron

reviews.text: I walked here from my house in Froideville for lunch with my family. Wow‚Ä¶what an enchanting, artistic, delicious experience. There is a new owner and this place is now Michelin star quality. Every detail was perfect and the atmosphere was both fine dining and relaxed. (The ‚Äúbad reviews‚Äù I see are regarding the previous ownership.) The service was the best I have had in Switzerland. We paid less than 100 CHF per person for a beautiful 3 course meal and drinks. There is no handicap or stroller entry but the staff helped carry the stroller in with me. Staff speak French and English. If you are looking for a fine dining experience for a special occasion or just to explore, very highly recommended!

We tried the 115 chf  menu for lunch. The food was good. The duck breadt was cooked to perfection. The amuse bouche was the best in the set. On top of everything, the services was incredibly good üëç

Peace, quality and competence! We had a great experience at lunch during the Desalpes wine fair. Excellent food and service, wine pairings made with expertise, plus a generous list of natural wines including some jems. Five stars to the sommellier for interpreting the different preference of the two of us, and changing the pairings to serve something personalized and spot on - we felt very well cared for! Price is fair for Switzerland. Merci et a bient√¥t!

places.generalDescription: Lausanne Palace is a luxurious heritage hotel that has been offering modern conveniences and palatial interiors since its opening in 1915. The hotel features seven restaurants and bars, including options for high-end French cuisine, sushi, and health-oriented dishes. Guests can enjoy the spa facilities with a swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna, hammam, and relaxation areas. The lavish rooms and suites offer stunning views of the city or Lake Geneva.

sources.snippet: This place has had more than a century to refine its luxury hospitality, and it‚Äôs nailed it. With some of the best food and drink in town, plus an outstanding spa, there‚Äôs little need to step outside and explore the city on its doorstep.
sources.shortName: Best hotels in Lausanne | Telegraph Travel

sources.snippet: Full of opulence and heritage, Lausanne Palace is a sparkling five-star hotel. No expense is spared with its palatial rooms, state-of-the-art spa centre and four featured restaurants. A wondrous Swiss marvel.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Lausanne, Switzerland

places.name: Lausanne Palace

reviews.text:
I would like to express my sincere appreciation for the wonderful experience during my recent stay at Lausanne Palace. The staff were exceptionally friendly and welcoming, and I would especially like to commend Mathew from the concierge team for his outstanding service - his professionalism and attentiveness truly enhanced our visit.

The breakfast, though modest in size, was absolutely spectacular. The quality of the food, the cozy atmosphere, and the genuinely caring staff made each morning a delight.

The hotel's location is superb, offering easy access to the best of Lausanne. The only shortcoming was the room's plumbing and electrical infrastructure, which showed signs of the building's age. However, this did not detract significantly from the overall experience, thanks to the warmth and excellence of the team.

Thank you for a memorable stay - I look forward to returning.

We had two rooms, one was a beautiful renovated room whereas the other was a little older. They were both very nice however. On the other hand, there was loud music in one of the rooms coming from the ground floor well into the night. Other than this it was a good experience.

Perfect experience and I'll be in 50 hotels this year!! I'll be back personally no matter what is booked! !Kind caring staff albeit a few too few of them! Rooms wonderful from lowest level booked. F&B excellent consist quality.,could use an extra staff service person. Social areas remain wonderful!
Just put back a few staff.. it's a little barren!

places.generalDescription: Nandanam is a popular Indian restaurant located just a short walk from the train station in Lausanne. The restaurant offers a stylish dining room and a spacious terrace where guests can enjoy their meals. Known for its delicious Indian cuisine, Nandanam serves up flavorful dishes such as butter chicken, palak paneer, and naan with cheese. The restaurant is often packed with patrons drawn to its authentic Southern Indian flavors and aromatic dishes. Reservations are highly recommended due to its popularity.

sources.snippet: Spice things up (literally) and head to our hands-down favorite Southern Indian restaurant right in the heart of Lausanne. It‚Äôs always packed, with incredible scents wafting from the kitchen. The dishes are all pretty spicy (so when it actually indicates spicy, be prepared!), but you won‚Äôt find these flavors anywhere else in Lausanne.
sources.shortName: 10 Cozy Spots to Spend with Your Valentine(s) 2022

places.name: Nandanam

reviews.text: Went there for the first time on a Tuesday night. Delicious and original food. Ordered calamari, fera and the carrots cake. All a bit pricey but very much worth it. Great service too.Perfect location : 3 minutes walk from Lausanne train station.

This Indian restaurant in Lausanne (near the station) is a gem! Very charming place, nice staff and, most importantly, fantastic food! They have a bunch of classics of Indian cuisine and everything I tried was very tasty. They have plenty of vegetarian options and their cocktails are really good. The right pick if you want Indian food for dinner!

Great restaurant in Lausanne and close to the train station especially if you plan to be going back to a major city the same day. The menu options are limited which was a bit disappointing but the food was well prepared. The server and staff is very attentive so please don't be shy to ask for clarification on the content for the day. 2 Thali here can be good for 3 people‚Ä¶

places.generalDescription: Pinte Besson is a historic bistro in Lausanne, offering regional and seasonal dishes within its preserved space adorned with wood and stained glass. In addition to this charming spot, the city boasts a variety of dining options ranging from traditional old Vaudois bistros like Cafe Romand and Cafe de l'Europe to modernized bistros such as cafes de Grancy and Bruxelles.

sources.snippet: There are numerous places in Lausanne to sample the cheese dish to end all cheese dishes, but historic pub La Pinte Besson is one of the best, and possibly the most atmospheric place to get stuck in to a fondue on a winter‚Äôs evening.
sources.shortName: Things to do in Lausanne ‚Äì¬†Guide to the city

sources.snippet: I was sad not to have a chance to sample the famous Swiss Fondue but if I return I would definitely try it at Pinte Besson, the city‚Äôs oldest restaurant and famous for serving the best fondue in town. I also visited the city during Lausanne √† Table, a food and wine festival with fine dining events in Lausanne and the local area. The signature event of the festival is Le Grande Table de Lausannois which is hosted in a different quirky location every year with food from some of the best local chefs.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Luxurious Things to Do in Lausanne, Switzerland

sources.snippet: Founded in 1780 (yep, you read that right), this restaurant radiates history and tradition. There are two sections of the restaurant, the downstairs which is more traditional with stone ceilings and wooden walls, and the upstairs which feels a bit more formal and brasserie-like. TLG tip: Spend some time walking around and looking at the photographs and pictures both downstairs and upstairs.
sources.shortName: 10 Cozy Spots to Spend with Your Valentine(s) 2022

places.name: Pinte Besson

reviews.text: Tonight we discovered a quaint, neighborhood, locals restaurant in Lausanne that was established in 1780.  Flowing with charm and personality, and full of people enjoying themselves. We had a wonderful farm to table salad, the best cheese fondue ever, and a side of hashbrowns that were to die for (the side of hashbrowns is not on the menu, but they will do it).  The wines were surprisingly good. I had the Merlot Ticino and my wife had a glass, actually several glasses, of Prosecco.  A real hidden gem!

We ordered the fondue and, in our opinion, it was terrible.

First of all, for ‚Ç¨55 for two people, we were served bread and a plate of cheese. And nothing else. No cold cuts, no potatoes, nothing. Just bread and cheese. Maybe that's normal for Switzerland, but we were expecting more.

Secondly, the fondue was extremely bitter - we guess too much wine was used. We left half of it uneaten because we simply didn't enjoy it.

The place itself is nice, and the staff is friendly. But the fondue is a 1/10. I can't recommend it.

My husband and I were so excited to eat at Pinte Besson considering how historical this establishment is! We made reservations just to be safe. The service was wonderful! The fondue was delicious (we did the tasting for two that also came with dry meats and dessert and it was plenty of food). Would highly recommend a meal here during your stay in Lausanne!

places.generalDescription: La Table du Lausanne Palace offers a scenic dining experience with stunning panoramic views of Lausanne and Lake Geneva. Chef Franck Pelux curates a contemporary French menu for diners to enjoy while taking in the beautiful surroundings. The restaurant is known for its promotion of local food and wines through various events such as pop-ups, wine auctions, farm visits, and even a Raclette battle.

sources.snippet: Recently awarded a second Michelin star, Franck Pelux and Sarah Benahmed have transformed La Table at the Lausanne Palace by evoking memories of places where their gastronomic careers have taken them. With a creative flair and an enthusiasm to share, their style has injected Lausanne with a new, fresh haute cuisine that is a pleasure for the senses.
sources.shortName: 10 Restaurants to Celebrate Special Occasions in Lausanne

places.name: La Table du Lausanne Palace

reviews.text: Excellent 2 star Michelin restaurant. Top notch food and impeccable service. Views of Lake Geneva are breathtaking. The menu has nice variety and the tasting menu is surprising and outstanding. Highly recommended.

We recently dined here for lunch, and the experience exceeded our expectations for both food and service.

Every course we had, as well as the ‚Äúsurprise dishes‚Äù were delicious and wonderful. We chose to order a la carte, but there was also the option to have the lunch tasting menu. I highly recommend the koulibiac for two.

The service was well choreographed, yet also warm and personable. Dishes were brought out and carried away in synchronized fashion. The owner and the chef each greeted us and spent time explaining the menu.

I highly recommend ‚Äútaking a detour‚Äù to visit this two Michelin star restaurant, a designation that is well deserved. Thanks for the wonderful experience!

Have been more than 6 times since chef Franck and Sarah Pelux took and presented French with Asian touch over Edgar's nouveau Italian cuisine(used to be our favorite restaurant in Lausanne). Surprisingly each time I went overall is more refined then before intending of cooking creation, service, selection of utensils‚Ä¶ now it becomes my best choice of restaurants in Geneva lake region. Excellent sommelier üëç

places.generalDescription: Tout un Monde is a charming small restaurant located just fifteen minutes from Lausanne, in the Vaud wine country. The dining room offers lovely views of the surrounding terraced vineyards and Lake Geneva. Chef Yohann Magne creates dishes using local ingredients, accompanied by a selection of Vaud wines. The restaurant also features a beautiful terrace with spectacular views of the manicured vineyards and Alps.

sources.snippet: Tout un Monde in the Lavaux wine region boasts an absolutely heart-stopping view of both the Alps and the Vineyards beneath and serves a menu of meat, fish and vegetables mostly from Swiss producers.
sources.shortName: Top Ten Luxurious Things to Do in Lausanne, Switzerland

places.name: Tout un Monde

reviews.text: Unbeatable view. Incredibly pleasant to spend an afternoon here, enjoying the view and indulging in great food. I assume its nicest during the day. I had fish and my partner had chicken, they were both great. There r some steep roads here so easiest to get there with a car.

Rather unpleasant experience, wanted to go for lunch there. The serveur was rather rude, he told me the kitchen is closed, which is not by itself a problem, but why is it on google indicated as open until 2300... Then he told me I would need to wait anyway for a long time... It sounded to me more as I was not wanted there üòÜ

Apart from that, I caught the stunning view over the lake - gorgeous!!!

The view is fantastic, but unfortunately the service felt quite dismissive. A bit more attention and friendliness would have made the experience much better.

We were told we couldn't sit in the dining area since we only wanted drinks, which was fine, but after that the service was not attentive.

I will not recommend this place. There are many other places out there with similar view.

places.generalDescription: Located in the Esplanade de Montbenon Park, Brasserie de Montbenon is a refined restaurant offering upmarket cuisine in a modernized bistro setting. The former ballroom has been transformed into a popular dining spot with airy and light-filled surroundings. In summer, the terrace provides stunning views of Lake Geneva and the distant mountains, while the grand interior offers a spectacular shelter during winter. The seasonal menu features local flavors such as fresh lake fish and cheesy Cordon Bleu.

sources.snippet: Opened at the end of 2014, this stylish brasserie occupies a prime location on the classy (and grassy) Montbenon park, a favourite Lausanne strolling and lounging spot since the 19th century.
sources.shortName: Restaurant ‚Äì Lausanne eating guide

sources.snippet: We know we talk about this place quite a bit‚Äìbut for good reason. There aren‚Äôt many places in Lausanne that romance us with the charm of the interior like Brasserie de Montbenon. Grand, yet so cozy, it‚Äôs the kind of spot that is perfect for an intimate date, or can host large parties with robust personalities.
sources.shortName: 10 Restaurants to Celebrate Special Occasions in Lausanne

places.name: Brasserie de Montbenon

reviews.text: One of my favourite go-to restaurants in Lausanne. Good service, ambiance and food! Cozy interior for winter and a beautiful terrace for summer! Tip: they make great salads!

We ordered drinks after watching a movie nearby. The atmosphere on Friday evening was great and it wasn't too loud. Many people were having dinner too. The staff were kind and the decoration was very warm and welcoming. Definitely worth stopping by even if it is just for drinks.

One of the best dining experiences in Lausanne. The setting is unbeatable, with sweeping views over the gardens, Lake L√©man, and the mountains. It feels both elegant and relaxed at the same time.

We ordered a mix of seasonal dishes and everything was spot on. The Vol-au-Vent with wild mushrooms was rich and comforting, the local fish dishes (filet de f√©ra and truite) were delicate and perfectly cooked, the seasonal salads with chanterelles, burrata, and fresh tomatoes tasted like summer on a plate, the shawarma was full of flavor, and the steak with b√©arnaise sauce was perfectly done with vegetables and the most delicious roasted potatoes. The balance between freshness, local ingredients, and indulgence is exactly what you want from a brasserie of this level.

Service was excellent, attentive, warm, and perfectly timed without ever feeling rushed.

Whether you come for a long lunch on the terrace or a dinner with friends, this place captures the best of Lausanne with beautiful views, local produce, and a lively atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Big thanks to Casandra & Mathew

places.generalDescription: Domaine Croix Duplex is a small, family-owned winery offering the best views of the lake and vineyards from its hillside terrace. The friendly staff will guide you through their variety of wines, with the local chasselas being a must-try. Visitors can enjoy peaceful wine tastings and may even be surprised by unexpected events like a DJ booth setting up for an unforgettable evening.

sources.shortName: Lausanne city trip ideas | Spring HIGHlights

places.name: Domaine Croix Duplex

reviews.text:
üìç Domaine Croix Duplex @ Lavaux, Switzerland

We visited Domaine Croix Duplex on a sunny morning while exploring the Lavaux wine terraces. The location is stunning-perched above Grandvaux with sweeping views of Lake Geneva and surrounding vineyards. It's an easy walk from the Grandvaux train station and sits perfectly along the vineyard trail.

We enjoyed a relaxing tasting on the outdoor terrace, sampling their local Chasselas and ros√© wines. The host was friendly and took time to explain each variety, even with the language barrier. The vineyard itself is peaceful and scenic-perfect for unwinding after a vineyard stroll.

Highly recommend stopping here for wine tasting if you're exploring Lavaux. Great wines, beautiful view, and a very local experience.

üïí Tip: Best to come mid-morning or around lunch hour for a quieter tasting experience.

I have been wine tasting around the world. Worst experience today at this establishment. We made reservations over 6 weeks ago. Showed up and there was a group of 20+ people in a wine tasting and food tasting experience who had complete preference over us. No problem great for them. We were placed in the corner and clearly secondary to them.  We were told they ran out of the cheese for our tasting (probably because of the big party) so we switched to just a wine tasting. Then waited 27 minutes for our tasting in which we walked inside for our wine and told they would come find us. After being served all our wines at once we were charged 52 CHF FOR 4 small pairings each. I am so saddened to leave this review but damn I am so disappointed . There are sooo many better places in the area to check out! Don't waste your time and money here.
A must see and taste , super views , Red and White wines of the best quality , overlooking the lake and the specific vinyards they grow , breathtaking balcony , must visit for wine lovers

places.generalDescription: La Grappe d'Or is a cozy and romantic restaurant located in a historic building in the Bourg district of Lausanne. The ambiance is Italian-style with exposed wooden beamed ceilings and a roaring wood fire, creating a relaxed atmosphere. The restaurant's menu features flavors from the French-Italian Alpine regions and has received 12 GaultMillau points. Visitors can enjoy delicious cocktails and meals while being attended to by incredibly friendly staff members.

sources.snippet: The restaurant screams cozy-romantic with its exposed wooden beamed ceiling and roaring wood fire. It was between these walls that Queen Sophie waited while her fianc√©, Juan, the future king of Spain, hurried up Rue du Bourg to buy an engagement ring. TLG tip: Snag David Bowie‚Äôs old table just next to the fireplace.
sources.shortName: 10 Cozy Spots to Spend with Your Valentine(s) 2022

places.name: Grappe d'Or

reviews.text:
First of all I was glad, that I got a table, even though my visit was on short notice. For that reason my table was close to the Main Street, but hey that is just fair.
The terrace is situated in a side alley and was a pleasant place to stay.

Service was perfectly fine, but nothing extraordinary.
The Amuse-Gueule was a fine little start.
As always the Swiss tartar was amazing.
My main course was a very tasty interpretation of a simple pasta dish. I liked it a lot.

The desert was a bit of an overkill, but I asked for it and even though it was very heavy, it was still a delight.

I am certain that I will return.

My husband and I landed here for an early evening cocktail after a long day of traveling. Every single member of the staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating. We were enjoying our time so much, we decided to ask if we could stay for dinner and due to a reservation cancellation, they were able to secure us a lovely table. The food was delicious! I recommend to order the fritto misto & ceviche. Wine & liquor selection was superb & the atmosphere was lively. I highly recommend!

Great restaurant in the heart of Lausanne. The food is great, and the service is impeccable. The atmosphere is super cozy; it feels like being at home around a table with friends. I highly recommend it for gatherings with friends or family. Also, don't miss out on their great selection of white wine.

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts, known as MUDAC, is a must-visit for anyone passionate about modern art and design. Nestled within the vibrant arts district of Plateforme 10 in Lausanne, this museum showcases an impressive array of contemporary designs, art crafts, and fine arts. The exhibits frequently challenge traditional boundaries between art and design, offering visitors intellectually engaging experiences that provoke thought.

sources.snippet: MUDAC makes a name for its temporary exhibitions, and stages around six shows a year. Some are designed by one artist alone, in which they go as far as creating their own scenography, while others are travelling exhibitions organised by museums around the word. There are also a couple of permanent displays: One on the second floor showcases contemporary glass design.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Lausanne (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Unique: Plateforme 10, the brand new art quarter that brings together the Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts (MCBA), the Museum of Design and Applied Contemporary Art (mudac) and the renowned Photo Elys√©e.
sources.shortName: Lausanne city trip ideas | Spring HIGHlights

places.name: Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts

reviews.text:
Mudac is an absolute must go! Also part of the new arts district Plateforme 10, I got the ticket that gave me entry to all 3 museums (Photo Elysee, MCBA & Mudac).

They are having a promotion whereby instead of 25CHF for one entry to each of the 3 museums within the period of 3 months, it's now 19CHF.

I really enjoyed the Surrealism exhibition! There was even an exhibition book at the entrance which provided insights on the pieces. I went in on a weekday and there was only a handful of people so it pretty much felt like I had the museum to myself!

It's definitely worth checking out this lovely museum. And if you've got the time, hop on over to Photo Elysee which is just downstairs.
Very good collections and ideas for art lovers and kids. It's an amazing experience to visit 3 museums at once. Highly recommend to come. üíù‚ù§Ô∏èüíó

Architecturally exciting,  the MUDAC (Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts) features several special exhibitions on science and downstairs of photography. We saw information on the latest developments in solar power and an exhibit on the US artist Tyler Mitchell.
The cafe is excellent, featuring beers from the best Swiss brewery: Brasserie¬†BFM¬†from Saignel√©gier.

places.address: Pl. de la Gare 17, 1003 Lausanne, Switzerland
